result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Burg Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber if approved by the jail administration.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Comply with all other conditions of his current probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Disbursements Journal Final.

Defendant Todd A. Burg in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable (on behalf of Cass Cousins) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:28 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Kryshak states plea agreement.
Atty Constable makes statements re: consecutive. Concurs with agreement stated.
State files amended information. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Kryshak agrees to repeater status. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Serve 120 days in jail. Consecutive to any other sentence he would be serving.  -STAYED-
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Placed on probation for 12 months, concurrent. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Comply with all other conditions of his current probation. 
No jail credit. 

Court advises 20 days postconviction.
